revision.text:
{{short description|English phrase initials used to answer questions from beginners}} {{other uses}} {{wiktionary|RTFM|RTFA}} '''RTFM''' is an [[initialism]] for the expression "'''read the fucking manual'''" – typically used to reply to a question that could have been easily answered from the product manual or documentation.
In [[expurgation|expurgated]] texts, substitutions such as "read the frickn' manual", "read the factory manual", "read the field manual", "read the flaming manual", "read the fine manual", "read the friendly manual", "read the [pause] manual" or similar variants are used.<ref>Howard, Michael, David LeBlanc, and [[John Viega]]. ''19 Deadly Sins of Software Security: Programming Flaws and How to Fix Them''. New York: McGraw-Hill/Osborne, 2005. {{ISBN|0-07-226085-8}}.</ref> .
==Possible origins== The initialism appeared in print in 1979 on the table of contents page of the ''[[LINPACK]] User's Guide''<ref>Dongarra, J.J., C.B. Moler, J.R. Bunch, and G.W. Stewart. ''LINPACK User's Guide''. Philadelphia: SIAM, 1979. {{ISBN|0-89871-172-X}}.</ref> in the form ''"R.T.F.M." – Anonymous'', suggesting that it was already well established. [[Cleve Moler]] has since revealed that a visit to [[Argonne National Laboratory]] by [[Tektronix]] software manager Ned Thanhouser during the development of [[MATLAB]] led to the anonymous quote.<ref>{{cite web |last=Moler |first=Cleve |title=The Tektronix 4081 |url=http://blogs.mathworks.com/cleve/2014/02/17/the-tektronix-4081 |work=Cleve's Corner |publisher=MathWorks Blogs |accessdate=2014-02-17}}</ref>
[[John Bear]]'s 1983 book ''Computer Wimp! 166 Things I Wish I Had Known Before I Bought My First Computer!'' discusses the author hearing employees of a computer store mention RYFM ("read your fucking manual").<ref name="sperberg19840403">{{cite news |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=e-gI2W-3JwkC&lpg=PA385&pg=PA261#v=onepage&q&f=true |title=Don't Be a Computer Wimp |work=PC Magazine |date=1984-04-03 |accessdate=24 October 2013 |author=Sperberg, Luther |pages=261}}</ref>
==List of similar initialisms== * {{Visible anchor|RTBM}} ("read the bloody manual") (In some countries, e.g., the UK and Australia, this is a fractionally more polite alternative with identical meaning<ref>{{cite web |url=http://foldoc.org/RTBM |title=RTBM definition |publisher=foldoc.com |accessdate=2009-12-08}}</ref>) * {{Visible anchor|RTFA}} ("read the fucking/featured article"—common on news forums such as [[Fark.com]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fark.com/comments/4047872/Routine-traffic-stop-has-man-up-in-arms-Er-caught-red-handed-Er-never-mind-just-RTFA |title=Routine traffic stop has man up in arms. Er, caught red-handed. Er, never mind, just RTFA |publisher=Fark.com |date=2008-11-28 |accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref> and [[Slashdot]], where using "TFA" instead of "the article" has become a [[Internet meme|meme]]) * {{Visible anchor|RTDA}} ("read the damn article") * {{Visible anchor|RTDM}} ("read the damn menu") * {{Visible anchor|RTDM}} ("read the damn manual") * {{Visible anchor|WABM}} ("write a better manual" – an answer complaining that the manual is not written well)<ref>{{cite web |title=RTFM is a four-letter word |url=http://software.ac.uk/blog/2012-03-27-rtfm-four-letter-word |work=Software Sustainability Institute |accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> * {{Visible anchor|RTFE}} ("read the fucking error") * {{Visible anchor|RTFM41}} ("read the fucking manual for once") * {{Visible anchor|RTFW}} ("read the fucking wiki") * {{Visible anchor|RTFC}} ("read the fucking chart" – a response that Physicians give to coders who submit inappropriate queries) * {{Visible anchor|RTFS}} ("read the fucking source" or "read the fucking standard")<ref>{{cite web|title=RTFS|url=http://www.catb.org/jargon/html/R/RTFS.html|work=The Jargon File (version 4.4.7)|access-date=8 March 2017}}</ref> * {{Visible anchor|RTFB}} ("read the fucking binary")<ref>{{cite web|title=RTFB|url=http://www.catb.org/jargon/html/R/RTFB.html|work=The Jargon File (version 4.4.7)|access-date=8 March 2017}}</ref> * {{Visible anchor|RTFQ}} ("read the fucking question") * {{Visible anchor|RTMS}} ("read the manual, stupid") * "STFW" ("search the fucking web") * "GIYF" ("[[Google Search|Google]] is your friend") * "JFGI" ("just fucking [[Google Search|Google]] it") * "DYOR" ("do your own research") * "LMGTFY" ("let me Google that for you")
==See also== {{Commonscat}} * [[Internet slang]] * [[man page]] (Unix manual) * [[Info (Unix)]] * [[Usability engineering]] * [[User interface design]] * [[FAQ]]
==References== {{reflist}}
